sen.j: 久良岐公園（くらきこうえん）は、横浜市港南区と磯子区にまたがる、面積約23万m2の総合公園。
sen.e: Kuraki Park is a park with an area of 230000 square meters that expend over Konan Ward and Isogo Ward in Yokohama City.
Kuraki Park is a park with an area of approximately 230,000 square meters that expands over Konan Ward and Isogo Ward in Yokohama City.
sen.cmt: 文法を一部修正しました。
sen.e: Kuraki Park is a park with an area of approximately 230,000 square meters that expands over Konan Ward and Isogo Ward in Yokohama City.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 汐見台 (横浜市)の造成にあわせて整備され、1973年に開園した。
sen.e: The park has developed and opened in 1973 at the same time as development of Shiomidai (Yokohama City).
The park was developed and opened in 1973 along with the development of Shiomidai (Yokohama City).
sen.cmt: 文法を一部修正しました。
sen.e: The park was developed and opened in 1973 along with the development of Shiomidai (Yokohama City).
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 名称はこの一帯の古い地名である久良岐郡から採られ、公募により決定した。
sen.e: The name was taken from Kuraki-gun, which is the place-name in old days, and decided from an appeal for public contributions.
The name was taken from Kuraki-gun, which is the place name in old days, and chosen from entries from the public.
sen.cmt: 公募 表現を変更しました。
sen.e: The name was taken from Kuraki-gun, which is the place name in old days, and chosen from entries from the public.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 中央付近に池があり、北側は散策路のある雑木林の先に久良岐能舞台がある。
sen.e: There is a lake in the middle of the park and on north side, there is a copse with a hiking course leading to Kuraki Noh-Butai (stage).
In the middle of the park lies a lake, and on the north side there is a copse with a walking trail leading to Kuraki Noh stage.
sen.cmt: 散策路→walking trail としました。
sen.e: In the middle of the park lies a lake, and on the north side there is a copse with a walking trail leading to Kuraki Noh stage.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 南側は運動広場や芝生広場、サクラの林、横浜市電の保存車両などがあり、春には花見客でにぎわう。
sen.e: On the south side of the park, there are a field of the lawn, a cherry blossom grove and conserved cars of Yokohama Municipal Tramway, and is alive with people viewing the cherry blossoms in the spring.
On the south side of the park, there are a lawn field, a cherry blossom grove and conserved cars of Yokohama Municipal Tramway, and is alive with people viewing the cherry blossoms in the spring.
sen.cmt: 芝生広場→lawn field としました。
sen.e: On the south side of the park, there are a lawn field, a cherry blossom grove and conserved cars of Yokohama Municipal Tramway, and is alive with people viewing the cherry blossoms in the spring.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 所在地 - 横浜市港南区上大岡3丁目、磯子区岡村8丁目、汐見台 (横浜市)1丁目
sen.e: Loaction: 3-chome, Kami-Ooka, Konan Ward, Yokohama City/8-chome, Okamura, Isogo Ward/1-chome, Shiomidai (Yokohama City)
sen.cmt: 市、区などでコンマで区切られるので、それぞれの住所との区切りがつかなくなってしまうので、「/」を使用しました。
sen.e: Location: 3-chome, Kami-Ooka, Konan Ward/8-chome, Okamura, Isogo Ward/1-chome, Shiomidai (Yokohama City), Yokohama City
sen.cmt: 横浜市 を最後に移動しました。スペルを修正しました。
sen.e: Location: 3-chome, Kami-Ooka, Konan Ward/8-chome, Okamura, Isogo Ward/1-chome, Shiomidai (Yokohama City), Yokohama City
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.e: Transport
Transportation
sen.cmt: transportation としました。
sen.e: Transportation
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 京急本線上大岡駅・屏風浦駅から徒歩約20分
sen.e: 20 minutes walk from Kami-Ooka Station and Byobugaura Station on Keikyu Main Line.
20 minutes walk from Kami-Ooka Station and Byobugaura Station on Keikyu Main Line
sen.cmt: ピリオドを削除しました。
sen.e: 20 minutes walk from Kami-Ooka Station and Byobugaura Station on Keikyu Main Line
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 上大岡駅・屏風浦駅・根岸線磯子駅より横浜市営バスまたは京浜急行バス久良岐公園前下車
sen.e: Alighting at Kuraki Park mae (infront) on Yokohama City Bus or Keihin Kyuko Bus from Kami-Ooka Stationand Byobugaura Station on Keikyu Main Line, or Negishi Line Isogo Station.

From Kami-Ooka Station or Byobugaura Station on the Keikyu Main Line or Isogo Station on the Negishi Line, take the Yokohama City Bus or Keihin Kyuko Bus and get off at Kuraki Koen-mae (front of Kuraki Park) bus stop.
sen.cmt: 一部表現を変更しました。
sen.e: From Kami-Ooka Station or Byobugaura Station on the Keikyu Main Line or Isogo Station on the Negishi Line, take the Yokohama City Bus or Keihin Kyuko Bus and get off at Kuraki Koen-mae (front of Kuraki Park) bus stop.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.e: There a pay parking lot.
There is a pay parking lot.
sen.cmt: is を追加しました。
sen.e: There is a pay parking lot.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.e: Area: 230762 square meters
Area: 230,762 square meters
sen.cmt: カンマを追加しました。
sen.e: Area: 230,762 square meters
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 園内の北側にある能舞台。
sen.e: It is a Noh-Butai located on north side of the park.
It is a Noh stage located on the north side of the park.
sen.cmt: stage のみとしました。
sen.e: It is a Noh stage located on the north side of the park.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 1917年（大正6年）に東京日比谷の帝国ホテル裏に建てられた。
sen.e: It was built at behind of Imperial Hotel, Tokyo Hibiya in 1917.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: It was built behind the Imperial Hotel in Hibiya, Tokyo in 1917.
sen.cmt: 一部表現を変更しました。
sen.e: It was built behind the Imperial Hotel in Hibiya, Tokyo in 1917.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 1931年に東京芸術大学の前身である東京音楽学校邦楽科に寄贈された。
sen.e: In 1931, the Noh-Butai was donated to Study of traditional Japanese music at the Tokyo Music School, the predecessor of the present Tokyo University of the Arts.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: In 1931, the Noh stage was donated to the department of traditional Japanese music at the Tokyo Music School, the predecessor of the present Tokyo University of the Arts.
sen.cmt: 邦楽科→department of traditional Japanese music としました。
sen.e: In 1931, the Noh stage was donated to the department of traditional Japanese music at the Tokyo Music School, the predecessor of the present Tokyo University of the Arts.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 同大学には1964年に能舞台が新設されたため解体保存されていた。
sen.e: In 1964, new Noh-Butai was built in the university therefore the Noh-Butai was taken apart and preserved.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: The Noh stage was taken apart and preserved since a new one was built in the university in 1964.
sen.cmt: 一部表現を変更しました。
sen.e: The Noh stage was taken apart and preserved since a new one was built in the university in 1964.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: しかし、宮腰賢治が譲り受け、当地に移築した。
sen.e: However the Noh-Butai was succeeded to Kenji MIYAKOSHI and reconstructed in the park.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: However, it was succeeded to Kenji MIYAKOSHI and reconstructed in the park.
sen.cmt: 一部表現を変更しました。
sen.e: However, it was succeeded to Kenji MIYAKOSHI and reconstructed in the park.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 1984年に横浜市に寄贈され、市民の能楽・茶道・日本舞踊などの活動に使われている。
sen.e: In 1984, the Noh-Butai was donated to Yokohama City, and has been used for residents' activity such as Nogaku, Sado and Classical Japanese dance.
In 1984, it was donated to Yokohama City, and has been used for residents' activities such as Nohgaku (the art of Noh), Sado (tea ceremony) and classical Japanese dance.
sen.cmt: 一部表現を変更しました。
sen.e: In 1984, it was donated to Yokohama City, and has been used for residents' activities such as Nohgaku (the art of Noh), Sado (tea ceremony) and classical Japanese dance.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 鏡板には、日本画の大家平福百穂による老松が描かれている。
sen.e: Hyakusui HIRAFUKU, who was an expert of Japanese Painting, drew old pine tree on Kagami-ita (the back board).
sen.cmt: 用語集にある「老松」は能の曲目のひとつですが、ここでの老松は単に老いた松なのでOld pine treeとしました。
sen.e: Hyakusui HIRAFUKU, who was an expert of Japanese painting, drew old pine tree on Kagami-ita (the back board).
sen.cmt: 一部表現を変更しました。
sen.e: Hyakusui HIRAFUKU, who was an expert of Japanese painting, drew old pine tree on Kagami-ita (the back board).
sen.cmt: 修正なし
